turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about USS Carpenter (DD-825).
turn.1: What was the USS Carpenter's first mission?
turn.2: With yard work complete by 12 January 1967, the destroyer resumed a fast-paced training regimen — including gunnery qualifications, antiaircraft drills, combat air patrol control, AN/SQS-26 sonar evaluation, and DASH operations — in preparation for her next deployment.
turn.3: Where was the USS Carpenter initially deployed?
turn.4: Departing Pearl Harbor on 6 March, "Carpenter" ultimately reached "Yankee Station" off Vietnam three weeks later.
turn.5: What was the USS Carpenter's primary mission at Yankee Station?
turn.6: Familiar plane-guard duties, punctuated only by the occasional sonar, helicopter, and DASH exercise with friendly submarines filled her first two weeks on station.
turn.7: What did the USS Carpenter do after performing plane guard duties?
turn.8: On 14 April, "Carpenter" became the surveillance operations ship for the task force, coordinating and tracking all surface and subsurface contacts for the task force on "Yankee Station".
turn.9: When did the USS Carpenter return to the United States?
turn.10: On 29 April, the destroyer stood into Subic Bay for a week of maintenance and minor repairs.
turn.11: Did the USS Carpenter have any other missions while in the South China Sea?
turn.12: After two more weeks on "Yankee Station", "Carpenter" proceeded north to Kaohsiung for joint sea-air training with the Taiwanese navy, arriving there on 23 May.
